Reviews.Title: PEPPY PHONE, DOES WHAT I WANTED & MORE--READON...
Reviews.Author: Daisy S "Daisy S"
Reviews.Content: This is my FIRST REGULAR ANDROID phone(other than ViewPad7 by Viewsonic). And before this, I had a HTC HD2 with Windows 6.5 (it was too buggy) and decided to go to an Unlocked HTC Android Phone. Since I am a huge HTC Fan (have been since HTC Excilabar-Dash). That said, this is how I gave a rating of 4.95:1) Fast - goes into programs, apps very fast. 5 stars2) WiFi - No problem QUICKLY hooking up to WiFi anywhere (at home or on the road). 5 stars3) Good basic Music Player - I love to play music and audio files and this does the job nicely.4.8 stars4) FM Radio - Easy to use and wonderful sound. 5 stars5) Easy to use menus - I learned this phone within 1 hour without referring to the manual!6) Added bonus--After I installed apps to my phone, I wanted to move them to my SD card. I downloaded the FREE APP called SUPERBOX from the Android Market (it is free and has 10 superb utilities including: Move to SD Card, UNINSTALL, File Manager, Task Killer, Battery Info, System Info, Memory Manager and more). Because of this program SUPERBOX, I was able to move my apps from phone memory to the SD Card! Android 2.2 and higher ASKS you at the time of each APP download if you want it on the SD Card or on the phone. Android 2.1 by default places the app on the phone. However, now that I have SUPERBOX, I have moved my APPS to my SD Card (after I installed them on phone). Note that Android prior to 2.1, you cannot move APPS to SD Card. (One of the reasons that I bought this phone it has 2.1).CONS (however, these can be "fixed")1) No File Manager! Minus 1/2 star! To fix this I went to the Android Market App and searched for FILE MANAGER, I found one I liked and installed and it is free and works great!2) Needed better Music Manager to move songs around in my playlists. Again Android Market App to the rescue, downloaded a Music Player FREE that I like and am so so happy that I can move songs around in my playlists.3) Poor TASK Manager! So back I go to the wonderful Android Market App Store! Yes, there I found a TASK Manager program FREE called SUPERBOX that has an Task/Memory Manager and a TASK KILLER and it frees memory so quickly--keeps this phone running smoothly and fast, fast fast!!!!4) MMS/INTERNET Settings: WiFi works right out of the box, however, as in ANY unlocked phone, you need to get the MMS/Internet settings from ATT or T-Mobile or whatever your carrier is. In my case, I am a ATT Customer and paid pre-paid for $25 worth of data and wanted to try this out in a non WiFi area. It did not work. So I placed the APN settings in myself and opps, they still did not work! Now I am somewhat of a techie so I knew most in the APN settings were inserted by me OK, but something was missing as I could not go on ATT Internet or MMS! Every phone accepts APN settings differently. So I called ATT and had to sweet talk them for about an hour because I am a pre-paid customer. Finally after I insisted for about one hour, the support person sent me to the post-paid department and the tech there simply SYNCED the settings to my phone and in just 5 minutes, I had data (internet) and MMS! I was so blessed in this because ATT does not like UNLOCKED non ATT phones, nor do they like to deal with Pre-Paid customers. However, I explained to them that I paid $25 for the LARGEST Monthly Data Pre-Paid Plan (ATT offers $5,$15, $25 good for 30 days)and I was very upset because I could not use my data, and when the ATT Rep heard this he was very helpful and this is why I was able to speak to the "higher end" Post Paid tech who within 5 minutes synced my phone with proper settings for both the MMS and Internet Data , both have worked rigtht then and have ever since! I mostly use WiFi at home and on the road, however, about 15% of the time, I need to get on the Internet in a location that does not have WiFi this is when I use my ATT Data. If you ONLY use WiFi and don't plan to use a pre-paid data plan as I do, then you will not need these settings from the carrier unless you MMS (send pictures or receive pictures).*I hope this helps you the person thinking of buying this phone or any unlocked phone as maybe my experience with this will assist you in making up your mind. As far as this phone is concerned, it is a wonderful phone for a beginner to smartphones, android phones and even wonderful for the more advanced person. This phone has gone BEYOND my expectations! And being an HTC/ANDROID phone icing on the cake! If anyone would like to comment or ask a question, I will answer. Hope that you have enjoyed my review.**Update August 16, 2011: Just checked the software OS and it showed 2.2.1 Android! At the time that I purchased this phone in May, 2011, I assumed that it had 2.1 Android OS. However, since I have been using the phone, I get on the internet often and notice that the phone automatically updates my APPS and programs (I set it up to do this). This is why I believe that the phone possibly updated to Android 2.2 Froyo since I just checked and it has Android 2.2.1! I do not think that this phone is upgradable to Android 2.3 Gingerbread. However I did a search on my computer and found that in the Android Marketplace there are apps for Gingerbread theme and other OS themes. Since I love the theme I have now, I am going to keep my 2.2 true to form and when I buy future Android 2.3 (Gingerbread) or 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) future phones, the themes will be real! There is only one CON about this phone: Screen is kind of small just a 3.2". My next Android will have a 4.3" at least!

Reviews.Title: Very nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Claret Esther Zarraga
Reviews.Content: I live in Venezuela and it works great,I can navegate and all the app avalible are amazing! I only have to be aware to erase the history on emails and text message to assure keeps working smooth... I am really happy with this phone!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Dre "Dre"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Nexus One but this one is perfect!Excellent price, pretty and exactly what I wanted.But if you are really into cell phones, this is not the best option. The android version needs to be updated, there are few limitations to the 2.1 version, sometimes it crashes but still it has never disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: Trully 3G phone... in Europe
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone some days ago while visiting europe, and despite all the comments here about not being 3G.. the true thing is that in fact it is. IT officially supports HSDPA 900/2100Mhz, bands that are mainly in use only in Europe, though I believe some US-based operators use that frequency as well.CONS:Up to android 2.1, no support for the lastest GINGERBREAD. No plans to offer an upgrade either.Short battery life, specially if you are an intensive data-and-calling user.Doesn't support skype. Although you can install it, the processor is too slow for the lastest release. No way making calls with it.Virtual keyboard: Doesn't feel as accurate as the iPhone, but you can get used to it.It can become hot when you're using intensive-processor tasks.You need to have a google account in order to take advantage of the phone. I don't know if I feel that familiar sending all my data to google......PROS:Removable battery: It trully helps to keep one on spareMicro-USB charger: It's becoming the standard, and I appreciate the fact that I don't have to carry yet another charger (the one from my blackberry works just fine)Response time: usually very fastSmall form-factor: I thought it would be bigger based on the images, but feels very comfy on hand.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart Phone...
Reviews.Author: Nicky "techky-nicky"
Reviews.Content: This phone isn't the best smart phone on the market but it certainly isn't the worst either. I have to disagree with the general perception of this device as "entry level" or "low end". I have owned this phone for only nine days and I'm already impressed. On the cosmetic front, it's a pretty good-looking device. On functionality, it offers what you need in a smart phone- 3G connectivity, Bluetooth, Friendstream (live status/photos/links updates from your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Flickr), massive storage capacity, excellent call quality, the syncing of emails and social networking is awesome... Overall, I think you get more than you pay for.I only have two gripes:1. The battery life. Under normal circumstances I suppose it could last two days but in my case it lasts a few hours since I'm constantly using the phone for emails, texts, browsing etc.2. The resolution could have been better but that is to expected considering price and all the other goodies this phone packs.

Reviews.Title: Great product and Great seller
Reviews.Author: campoex
Reviews.Content: The phone works as expected and one thing I like about it, is the Android Market application where you can download a lot of useful tools for this operating system.The seller shipped this product immediately and I had it in no time.

Reviews.Title: Great little Android
Reviews.Author: HelenLeggatt
Reviews.Content: This is my first Android. I love the feel of it in my hand (good weight/grip) and the touch-screen is wonderful - reactive and larger than others in the price range.

Reviews.Title: Review of HTC Wildfire phone
Reviews.Author: Vadim
Reviews.Content: Very nice low budget Android phone, I bought it for my wife who needs it primarily for emails and chats.The screen is pretty simple with basic resolution that can not be compared with my Nexus One.Processor is pretty weak, but the system itself runs fine.Battery life is fine, the phone reception is outstanding.The camera is standard 5Mp, flash is nice and can be used as a flashlight.The phone was unlocked, but branded, with T-Mobile boot screen.Nice phone for the people with low budget, but looking for Android based touch smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The Wildfire is everything I'd hoped it would be. It's compact and solid with a feel of quality. Though it's not a high-end phone, you'd never know it. My only concern prior to purchase was the poor reviews of the low screen resolution. Don't worry about it... unless you're already used to a very high resolution, you'll be pleased with the screen on the Wildfire.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Destroky
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my cousin, and so far he likes it a lot. He lives in Lebanon, and the phone is working there using the Sim Card he has.All I can say is that it works overseas if you have family that needs a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Great cost-benefit!
Reviews.Author: brgrazi
Reviews.Content: Loved it! works perfectly well. Battery doesn`t last as long as I expected, but I guess this is normal when it comes to smart phones. Totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Ecellent HTC product
Reviews.Author: Charmaine Gellineau
Reviews.Content: This mobile phone surpasses my expectations in terms of features and capability, Sleek smooth face, slim line and easy to use.All in all an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: My new best friend
Reviews.Author: D. Bren
Reviews.Content: Excellent for a first-time owner of a smartphone. I thought it would be too small, given other HTC models with larger screen sizes. But I also want to carry it around in my pocket, so it's a good compromise.The screen resolution is fine. I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews on bad res. I don't feel like I'm missing out on much, as I'm using it as a phone, not an HDTV.The digital qwerty keyboard is ok for me, got big thumbs but when I flip the phone on the side it's comfortable. Just have to get used to the change and after a while I found I'm typing much quicker.Battery life is like other smartphones, not great but decent, and I have it charging through the USB on my work computer, so as long as you're aware of this then you should be fine.My only complaint is that the unlocked version came from Asia, so it has some strange pre-installed lanague capabilities that I will never use. But other than that small inconvenience (only made a difference when I turned it on the first time), I'm very happy and I've spent hours on this guy with all of the interesting Android apps available for free.

Reviews.Title: Dead Phone
Reviews.Author: Ruel
Reviews.Content: This was my first andriod phone and I was very much satisfied with it for the first month, then all of a sudden it DIED.  Just like that, no I didn't drop it nor wet it or whatever. I very careful with my phones, I've had phones last me a year or 2 until I decide to trade up. I'm also not happy with the fact that after I bought the phone, the next day the same phone cost $25 less from the same store. AMAZON likes to do that. Everytime I buy something, a few days later the price from the same provider for the same product drops a few dollars!

Reviews.Title: Super small phone
Reviews.Author: Franck
Reviews.Content: I am probably going to describe it as a small nexus one.a 5 mp phone with a small processor and the battery life won't last long if you spend all day texting or browsing the internet.since it's an android phone it consumes a lot of energy.the graphic resolution is good and everything is simple.the android market allows you to download to access a lot of applications and it's unlocked so you can basically use it worldwide.the marchand was good and I receive the phone is good condition(new) on time.I recommend him just in case you want to purchase something.

Reviews.Title: some past tense version product, limited capacity
Reviews.Author: GoldenEye
Reviews.Content: I bought this, because I saw it ranked pretty high.I have used this for three months. and found it is not impressive.internet speed is low. the camera picture quality is poor.and the tel number format is, xxxxxxxxxx, very hard to read,  not like the one we used to, xxx-xxx-xxxx.Time format is British style.I believe there got some deal better than this at the similar price.

Reviews.Title: The worst nightmare when you buy a smartphone
Reviews.Author: NormalGuy
Reviews.Content: This is my worse nightmare. I bought it on Amazon, arrive a few days later. I charge the phone, start it, everything seems ok. Very slow phone but ok. Am hour later, I receive an update from HTC. Gladly, I update the phone. Shutdown the phone, restart it and then nothing. It tries to boot up but cannot, no display, nothing. IT is not a phone anymore, just a piece of dead hardware. It took me a total of 63 hours to learn about androids, find a new firmware, reload the phone with a new firmware by using special software to talk to it and special keystrokes. Fortunately I am an engineer and used my stuborness to succeed but do not wish that experience to my worse ennemy.Then, I found out that it is as slow as a turtle. I gave it to some kid for free, telling him to never accept any upgrade from HTC as it will kill the phone.If you think this is a good deal, think twice.If you think to buy another HTC phone, think twice.I have been given a mytouch 4G from HTC and HTC just makes bad phones as HTC sense software on all HTC phones is well know to create big problems.

Reviews.Title: Phone is a UK phone and internet was a nightmare to get working. It is very slow. Wasted my money
Reviews.Author: Les Vandever
Reviews.Content: Internet is extremely slow, once I found how to get it to work at all. This phone is junk and is by far the worst cell phone I have ever had since I got my first one in 1999.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: gabriel ET
Reviews.Content: I really liked the product recommended 100% I feel totally happy not hesitate to buy recommended ..... sending was done perfectly

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Lenin
Reviews.Content: I have a year with this htc. although I have poblem with little internal memory capacity and with those very large applications. I'm very happy with this phone. The WiFi connection is very fast. would give 5 stars if tuevieran larger internal memory.

Reviews.Title: Quick & Amazing
Reviews.Author: Ganiber
Reviews.Content: Very nice products i like it alot and customers do as wellonly if i can get discount when i take many of it everytime this is will be great

Reviews.Title: Brand new in box
Reviews.Author: Stram
Reviews.Content: I shipped the phone to someone I know in Ghana, Africa. She popped in the sim card and it works great

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners...
Reviews.Author: Alphastriker00
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing this phone, I was trying not to get wrapped up in this whole 'smartphone universe'. I had a LG Env touch from Verizon for 3 years. When recent opportunities opened up, I will be traveling to China within a year for school. So I had to go from CDMA to GSM. But I wanted to make sure that my phone would work in any country I travel to. So I reviewed many unlocked phones and judged on which one would be a good flexible option. I will admit there are a few better selections, but for price this phone is overall positive.The phone is a design from 2010, so it does not have dual core or quad core processing. It runs at most 500Mhz, so don't expect to play Angry Birds very well. This phone is what I was looking for. Something that makes calls, texts, and can check my email. I don't do facebook, twitter, or fliker...even though the programs were already installed. This gave me a good chance to take a step into the world of social connection without being too exposed.The control and functions are a bit different from the normal OS of cell phones, more computer designed similar to Linux. The phone has hardware, and the apps and OS together work to expand or limit functions based on your implementation.

Reviews.Title: awful phone
Reviews.Author: Rosa Maria Lee
Reviews.Content: Useless phone, and a waste of money. Having so much problem with it with dialing, answering phone. Internet is worse. Wish I did not buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Buy something else.
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: Bluetooth was broken, camera had significant delays in taking any photo. Don't know if that's just product performance, or defect. White powder falling out of earpiece. Packaging was ghetto - clearly not original packaging; the one-page instruction manual was a bad photocopy or print-out and it looked like whatever printed it was running out of toner.

Reviews.Title: Excelente celular
Reviews.Author: David CR
Reviews.Content: Muy requete bien jaja me a salido super bueno y muy completo, desbloqueado perfecto listo para usar y escargar miles de aplicaciones gratis

Reviews.Title: htc wildfire
Reviews.Author: Agus
Reviews.Content: this was the cellphone that i want it. i must say that it was perfect! that's what I've expecting. really on schedule and excellent conditions. i totally recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Bayo Adewoye
Reviews.Content: I love the phone and I will still buy two more for my families. Thanks when I am ready I will contact you by log in to purchase

Reviews.Title: HTC Wildfire A333
Reviews.Author: Josue
Reviews.Content: Pasados algunas semanas con el equipo en mano puedo decir que es una maravilla. Su aspecto estético es impresionante, es mi primer teléfono HTC.Estaba ansioso de probar el Sistema operativo Android. Puedo decir que es muy superior a los BB y a los nokia, muy personalizable, el hecho de puedes descargar muchas aplicaciones desde el market le da un plus adicional al producto, es rapido y no presenta ningun problema con a deteccion de los servicios de telefonía de mi pais, Ecuador; me ha detectado a todas las operadoras de servicio.Tal vez los únicos inconveniente que le veo son la duración de la batería que se consume mas rapido sobre todo cuando haces uso intenso del wifi y el hecho de la bendita obsolencia programada de HTC no permite un update del S.O. cuando el hadrware tranquilamente lo soporta. Aunque el segundo punto se lo puede obviar gracias a que se le puede realizar un rooteo para actualizar el android a una version superior.En resumen puedo decir que se trata de un gran telefono de gama media, muy recomendable.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone.
Reviews.Author: Bruno T. Villela
Reviews.Content: Best option if you need to go back to a country that does not provide 3G services. As an international student I looked for a smart phone which would work in both Europe and Brazil. This is the best option I found !!!!

Reviews.Title: Buen dispositivo
Reviews.Author: Dany Lopez "Almustafa"
Reviews.Content: En general todo perfecto, solo que un par de veces, cuando abro alguna aplicacion algo pesada, el dispositivo se reinicia solo.Esto me ha pasado solo 2 veces y no representa mayor problema más que esperar que se encienda otra vez.Saludos

Reviews.Title: ****BEWARE NOT UNLOCKED****
Reviews.Author: tecwerks
Reviews.Content: I just received this item today. Put my T-mobile SIM card in and a message keeps coming up that the "network is locked*. I will call the supplier tomorrow and see if it is an easy fix, if not, I will be sending it back so right now for something that should have worked out of the box I give it 1 star since I actually like the look, feel and quality of the phone. But bottom line is, if it will not work in the USA then it becomes a pretty expensive paper weight. Luckily since I purchased from Amazon I am confident I can return it, warranty or not.Update: The phone I received was NOT UNLOCKED. I have just paid another unlocking service $9.95 for a unlock code. I blame Amazon for faulty advertising. I have not yet received the unlocking code and if that does not work the phone will be returned.

Reviews.Title: Phone would be great if I could read Arabic.
Reviews.Author: The Three Woods "mommy2lile"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone unlocked to avoid having a contract through my carrier. Hindsight, I would have rather have gotten a free phone with a $350 early termination fee than went this route. The phone arrived in great condition though the manuals, etc. were all in another language. Not a big deal since I could always get the manual in English online. I just assumed the English version was somehow forgotten in the package. Once the phone was charged up and turned on, I realized I was in for trouble. It was in Arabic. I called HTC, who are fantastic to work with, and they walked me through some steps to get the phone to show English. Unfortunately, every thing they suggested did not work. They finally recommended I return the phone and purchase another HTC Wildfire through a local company. Amazon is great about returns, thankfully, or I'd be up a creek without a paddle. I love their excellent customer service and was assured I would be getting a full refund. This could have ended a lot worse than it did. I could have been out a lot of money. Lesson learned - DO NOT purchase any phone that does not specifically say it's a US version unless you want it in another language. Certainly do not purchase a warehouse deal to save a few bucks because it's likely not to be what you bargained for.

Reviews.Title: Some problems
Reviews.Author: Goncalo Ferraz "The Seeder"
Reviews.Content: It's a great piece of hardware, BUT check for network types: just WCDMA and GSM. It is NO 3G network, so 4G even less. The HTC Android contacts management is damn hard to use. There is so many things you probably gonna get lost, like I did. It is no intuitive at all. Anyway, it is a great product: tight, shinny, beautiful and strong, all good, but the network and software lacks a bit.

Reviews.Title: SHAM
Reviews.Author: ILUM.2007
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't know if this phone is a good phone to use because I CANT USE IT.  I ordered this phone last month and took it with me to Europe.  IT DOESNT WORK like it promises because its email code to register is either fake or stolen.  I cant register the phone to use it at all so my money is in the garbage along with this phone.  Since I am still in Europe I cant possibly return it.  DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE unless you want to cut up your money and throw it out the window or burn it.  I am very very dissapointed and extemely MAD !!!Amazon should do something about these types of lies/shams .......

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Sunset Distribution Company
Reviews.Content: Dont ever use. This person steals icons. Product does not work. Nothing by this company works. Stay Away. Not a good product to use at all. Dont even take the chance. Why take that chance with a million other products to choose....BTW...S2e TV has the best icon ever....

Reviews.Title: decent android phone, small size, LONG battery life
Reviews.Author: Robert Shuler
Reviews.Content: I like this phone because it is small, Android compatible, and fits nicely in my pocket.  A pleasant surprise is it has about twice the battery life of most smartphones, so mine is working long after everyone else's has died.Cons are it only runs about half as fast as the others, so will not run Skype at all, will not run many games, and does not have a front facing camera.  Of course I'm being redundant.  Without the horsepower to run video over IP, it couldn't actually use a front camera.  On the other hand, a low resolution front camera might enable the video to work, due to lower processing requirements.  It is great for Kindle book reading because of the long battery life.  Takes a long time for the file system to come up when plugging into my computer.  But has a great camera.  Of course, it's a phone camera, and hard to work, so if you hand it to someone they may not be able to take your picture, and no stand or self-timer, but takes better pictures than my Nikon, so I have started taking only this phone and no camera on vacations.

Reviews.Title: Like the HTC interface, phone is not so great.
Reviews.Author: Antonio Diaz "muzongooo"
Reviews.Content: Overall the phone works well, is small and portable and the HTC interface is one of the bests in the Android world.Nevertheless, here are a few things to consider that I didn't like so much:- I found the phone to be on the slow side. I now own a Samsung Galaxy pro and the processor speed is just a little bit faster but it does show a lot.- I bought this phone to use it in Mexico just to find out that calls made through the 3G network worked fine, but HS data transmission such as 3G didn't work. I would still get internet through Edge but it's incredibly slow and not worth it.- Finally, this is a personal issue, I prefer phones with a full qwerty keyboard and the virtual one from this phone I found it to be too difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Donna J. King
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone from Alltel and used it with Alltel serviceI received it and had problems with it making calls.  I couldn't use the phone at all.  I sent it back and received a replacement with only slightly improved performance.  The tech at Alltel walked me througn a calibration which seemed to help, but in a few minutes the problem was back.  The tech explained that the phone turns off the screen when you put it to your face to keep you from accidentally pushing any buttons while talking.  This is a good idea, but then if I needed to press numbers like a voicemail password, it would not allow me to do it.  I calibrated it three times, and it showed no improvement.  The most frustrating thing, was that if I gave up and decided to end the call, the phone would not disconnect the call.  I had to remove the battery to get the phone to end the call. I sent it back and decided to keep my Blackberry for now.  I was looking forward to upgrading, but will probably wait until Verizon gets the Iphone now.I have a hard time believing that I got the only two broken phones, I believe this is an ongoing problem for HTC.  I was not using a protective cover for the phone so it was not the reason there was a problem. I hope this helps some people make an informed decision.  I gave the phone 2 stars because I liked the concept.  It looked like if would be fun if it would only work.  Have a great day!!!

Reviews.Title: Product didn't arrive
Reviews.Author: Rene Clausen Nielsen
Reviews.Content: The phone was supposed to be in a bundled package but it wasn't. That was obviously upsetting, but the seller refunded the full amount very quickly making it an acceptable experience.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE PHONE, DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I bought an HTC wildfire from Altell when I renewed my contract.  For about the first month, it was great, but after that it all went to hell.  The phone locks up all the time, not allowing to anwser phone calls, or hang up when you want too.  The text keys actually stick, yes I said stick.  ITS A TOUCH SCREEN, THE KEYS SHOULDNT STICK!  Battery can be unpredictable.  When it goes to 10% life, sometimes it takes forever for it to fully die.  Other times, it can say 10%, and then die within a couple of minutes.  This I find frustrating because I do not charge an electronic device until the battery completely dies.  This allows the battery to last longer and does not put as much of a strain.  Also when I type in a phone number and press send, it will just clear the number away and wont call.  My final complaint with this absolutly horrible, and I mean HORRIBLE phone is that it will go into roaming at random.  I can be sitting in my car, and have full signal, then BOOM, I'm roaming.  I will never buy another HTC again for as long as I live.  I warn you, stay away from this phone, it is a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Excelente telefono
Reviews.Author: Marcelo
Reviews.Content: Me gusta mucho este modelo de HTC muy simple y buen diseño a demas es muy completto y el proveedor correcto cumplio bien con los tiempos de entrega gracias ...

Reviews.Title: wrong color of item
Reviews.Author: charm03
Reviews.Content: hi i am currently enjoying the htc wildfire that i ordered. but at first i was annoyed cause what i have been ordered is a color brown htc wildfire but what they send me is a black one.. its just i decided not to return it because it will take another weeks for me to use the phone. and ofcourse i cant help it cause im too excited to use the phone. so there it goes my comment.

Reviews.Title: Deal
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Borin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic seller! Sent the product in the same day and it arrived perfectly.Recomended.Thanks.

Display: TFT capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors, 240 x 320 pixels, 3.2 inches, Multi-touch input method, Accelerometer sensor for UI auto-rotate, HTC Sense UI

Stereo FM radio with RDS, GPS with A-GPS support, Bluetoot v2.1 with A2DP, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g, Internal Memory: 384 MB RAM; 512 MB ROM. Memory Card Slot: microSD, up to 32GB.
ProductInfo.Name: HTC Wildfire A3333 GSM Smartphone Unlocked with Android OS, 5 MP Camera and Wi-Fi - Unlocked Phone - International Version - Mocha
